emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Code Synthesis
emerging_technologies.description: AI systems capable of not only assisting but also autonomously generating complex software code based on high-level requirements.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could lead to a significant shift in the job market for software developers, potentially reducing demand for entry-level coding positions.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: High initial resistance due to trust issues, but adoption would accelerate with proven reliability and integration into existing development environments.

emerging_technologies.name: Fully Autonomous Urban Transport
emerging_technologies.description: Vehicles and public transit systems that operate without human intervention, optimizing traffic flow and reducing accidents.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduces traffic congestion and pollution, changes urban landscapes, and impacts employment in the transport sector.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires regulatory frameworks, public trust, and significant infrastructure investment.

emerging_technologies.name: Neuralink-like Brain-Computer Interfaces
emerging_technologies.description: Interfaces that allow direct communication between the human brain and computers, enhancing cognitive capabilities or controlling devices.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Potential ethical concerns regarding privacy, identity, and enhancement disparities.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Highly dependent on overcoming health risks, ethical debates, and achieving widespread acceptance.

emerging_technologies.name: Sustainable Energy Harvesting Nanotech
emerging_technologies.description: Nanomaterials that can capture and convert ambient energy from sunlight, heat, or vibrations into electrical energy.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could lead to widespread energy independence, reducing reliance on traditional power grids.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Scalability, cost-effectiveness, and integration into existing infrastructure.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI Code Assistants
mainstream_technologies.description: Advanced AI tools that suggest code completions, fix bugs, and suggest optimizations during software development.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widespread in software development teams, integrated into major IDEs, with significant improvements in productivity.

mainstream_technologies.name: Blockchain Identity Verification
mainstream_technologies.description: Use of blockchain for secure, decentralized identity management, reducing fraud and enhancing privacy.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Standard practice in financial sectors, governmental services, and increasingly in consumer applications for secure identity verification.

epoch_themes.description: AI becomes ubiquitous, influencing almost every aspect of technology and daily life.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Changes in job markets, education, and personal productivity, with potential issues of automation bias and AI ethics.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Shift towards AI-driven governance, personalized services, and autonomous decision-making systems.

epoch_themes.description: Technological advancements focus on reducing environmental impact and promoting sustainability.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Encourages eco-friendly behaviors, supports circular economies, and promotes resource conservation.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increase in green policies, investment in renewable energy, and a push towards zero-waste cities.

epoch_themes.description: Exploration of technologies that enhance human capabilities through direct integration with technology.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Raises questions about human enhancement, equality, privacy, and the essence of being human.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Regulatory discussions on human enhancement, ethical frameworks for tech integration, and public debate on enhancement ethics.
